issue_description: # [BUG]: Progress Page UI of Learner Dashboard broken in RTL languages ### Describe the bug The UI of the 'Progress' part of the learner dashboard page overflows and is broken in RTL languages such as Arabic. Occurs in the mobile layout as well. ### URL of the page where the issue is observed. https://www.oppiatestserver.org/learner-dashboard ### Steps To Reproduce 1. Go to the learner dashboard's progress page 2. Switch your language to Arabic ### Expected Behavior The UI should be fully mirrored properly for RTL languages and it should not be broken. ### Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/oppia/oppia/assets/73329256/da225a0c-2600-460c-ba9a-a8ab752b6cfa ### What device are you using? Desktop ### Operating System MacOS ### What browsers are you seeing the problem on? Chrome, Other ### Browser version Brave: Version 1.63.165 Chromium: 122.0.6261.94 (Official Build) (arm64) ### Additional context _No response_ ### Tips for developers Before addressing the bug, please identify which PR caused the issue (you can follow the steps [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/How-to-find-the-commit-which-introduced-a-bug)). If you identify the PR, comment on the issue with a link to it. If not, mention the commit hash of the oldest commit you saw the bug on (and the month and year it was made in). Also, if this is your first issue, please make sure to follow https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#choosing-a-good-first-issue and https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#setting-things-up before claiming it. Thanks!

issue_comments.body:
This is happening because the padding is not being given in the right side as its being given in the left side! So this can be fixed by giving a uniform padding all around the content of that block.

This can be done by changing the padding from `padding: 0 0 30px 40px ` to `padding: 0 30px 30px 40px ` in progress-tab class, which is present [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/e51de7ed92ecef9fa9850d9f552bb558bd401209/core/templates/pages/learner-dashboard-page/progress-tab.component.html#L161) .

The second step is to remove the `left:51px` property from [here](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/e51de7ed92ecef9fa9850d9f552bb558bd401209/core/templates/pages/learner-dashboard-page/progress-tab.component.html#L58), it not only fixes the issue with the language change it also makes the English version look neat.

Third step is to add `right: 10px;` to [this class](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/e51de7ed92ecef9fa9850d9f552bb558bd401209/core/templates/pages/learner-dashboard-page/progress-tab.component.html#L347), this will take create a gap between the info link and the fractions text.

@hrshkshri I would like to work on this, can you assign me this issue!?

Hey @aswin2108 
Wait until `triage needed` is removed.
Also, can you show us a demo of the solution on your local machine?

Thanks.
@hrshkshri I would show the demo by eve as I don't have my personal laptop at the moment. I used the chrome dev tools to find the proposed fix! Hope the issue will get reviewed by that time!ðŸ™‚
@seanlip @hrshkshri I request you to not assign this to anyone else. I will send the recording by tonight! Got held up in a work yesterday!
@aswin2108 We will assign this to the first person who shows a working demo as per our contribution guidelines -- no special exceptions.

@seanlip @hrshkshri pls check [this](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/discussions/20000), because of this I am not able to replicate the similar situation in my local repo! But I did solve this issue by editing the css using chrome developer tools.
Hi @Vir-8, thanks for proposing this as a good first issue. I am removing the label for now and looping in @DubeySandeep to approve the label. It will be added back if approved. Thanks!

Additionally, the `left:51px` property should be removed from the skill-proficiency class, and `right: 10px;` should be added to another relevant class to ensure proper alignment.

The ngClass directive is used to conditionally apply the 'empty-section' class based on whether the skill proficiency section is empty. The ngStyle directive is used to dynamically set the 'margin-top' property based on the window width, allowing for responsive design adjustments. These directives help in managing the layout and spacing dynamically depending on the user's context.

Removing the 'left:51px' property from the skill-proficiency class could improve the UI by preventing fixed positioning that might not translate well in RTL languages. It ensures that the layout is more flexible and can adjust to different language orientations, making the design look consistent and neat across both RTL and LTR languages.

Adding 'right: 10px;' to a class in the progress-tab.component.html creates a gap between the info link and the fractions text. This adjustment helps in maintaining proper spacing and alignment, particularly in RTL layouts where elements need to be mirrored and spaced appropriately from the right side.

The skill-proficiency-heading section contains the title of the skill proficiency and an info tooltip, which provides additional information about badges earned. Its design affects the user experience by providing clarity and accessibility to users, ensuring they understand their progress and achievements. Proper alignment and spacing in this section are crucial, especially in RTL languages, to maintain readability and usability.
